publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5185 Mrs Nanette Milne: Parkinson’s Disease—That the Parliament supports the launch of the Parkinson’s Disease Society’s "Get it on time" campaign to raise awareness of the importance of ensuring that people with Parkinson’s in hospitals and care homes get their medication on time, every time; recognises that, when patients do not get their medication on time, every time, their Parkinson’s symptoms become uncontrolled and they can become very ill; notes that there is currently no known cure for Parkinson’s; supports the efforts of all those engaged in research into all aspects of Parkinson’s disease at centres across the United Kingdom, and congratulates the society for investing more than £30 million in research since it was founded in 1969.

S2M-5185 Parkinson’s Disease (lodged on 17 November 2006) Donald Gorrie*, Tommy Sheridan*, Alex Johnstone*, Dave Petrie*, Mike Pringle*, Murdo Fraser*, Bruce Crawford*, Nora Radcliffe*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Bill Butler*, Margaret Mitchell*, Phil Gallie*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Mr Ted Brocklebank*, Ms Sandra White*, Christine Grahame*, Mr Jim Wallace*, Michael McMahon*, Margaret Jamieson*, Bill Aitken*

S2M-5185 Parkinson’s Disease (lodged on 17 November 2006) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Murray Tosh*, Mr David Davidson*, Jackie Baillie*, John Swinburne*, Fergus Ewing*, Euan Robson*, Fiona Hyslop*, Alex Neil*, Carolyn Leckie*, Trish Godman*, Rosie Kane*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Brian Adam*
S2M-5185 Parkinson’s Disease (lodged on 17 November 2006) Chris Ballance*, Shiona Baird*, Shona Robison*, Marlyn Glen*, Ms Maureen Watt*, Linda Fabiani*, Michael Matheson*, Eleanor Scott*
S2M-5185 Parkinson’s Disease (lodged on 17 November 2006) Frances Curran*
S2M-5185 Parkinson’s Disease (lodged on 17 November 2006) Dennis Canavan*
